website_summaries.verdict: This folding exercise bike is a real space saver, especially if room is an issue at home. It seems to be most comfortable for taller users.
pros: Folds to half its original size
Wheels make it portable for storage
Offers eight levels of magnetic tension for varied workouts
Bike is designed for individuals from 5'1" to 6'5" tall
Large LCD display tells time, distance, calories burned, speed, and other metrics
cons: Assembly can be challenging, especially the tensioner
May be challenging for shorter individuals to use comfortably

customer_reviews.title: Just to be clear about the capacity
customer_reviews.text: Here's a photo of the label on the front support
customer_reviews.author: CZ

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: My only con is a small cosmetic defect; the plastic in front is cracked(as pictured). Other than that, this bike is excellent for the price. The sticker on the frame I received does say it caters to up to 400lbs unlike other reviews have stated. The bike is very simple to put together, I assembled it by myself in less than 30 minutes; no special tools required, everything comes in the box. It rides very smoothly and very quietly. It is also very sturdy. The seat is nice and big and well cushioned for support. As a heavier person I am pleased with this product and it's made working out at home comfortable and easy!
customer_reviews.author: Kodaki

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BIKE FOR BEGINNERS
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this I weighed around 350 lbs. Since then I have put close to 1500 miles on it, and let me say, the thing is still going strong. I am now down to 258 lbs, losing 183 lbs total. My actual starting weight was 441 lbs. The Exerpeutic Gold 500 XLS is easy to put together, it's pretty light weight, and it has been a huge fundamental in my weight loss. I couldn't be more pleased. I highly recommend purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Allen

customer_reviews.title: For those having trouble with not enough resistance.
customer_reviews.text: Inside the cap you'll find the mechanism that creates tension. starting off practically all the levels felt the same. I was thinking to myself what the hell? So I took it back apart upon closer inspection, you'll notice that there's a little nut that says on the bottom of the metal piece. now if you loosen the metal nut lower all the way to the bottom, then lower the metal piece all the way to the bottom that will create more tension. Once you put it back together, you'll notice that the hardest setting is like doing a squat workout. Thank you very much come again.
customer_reviews.author: MasterTRoll

customer_reviews.title: Great for a month...
customer_reviews.text: As others have said on here, the bike was great for the 1st month (to the day) then both of the peddle straps broke (which isn't a huge deal but they should last longer than a month, picture included) and around the same time the bike began to make a terrible clicking noise (video with sound included) I am currently in contact with the manufacturer, but they have gone silent on me for the past week after I requested a replacement bike.
customer_reviews.author: Bschmidt

customer_reviews.title: Exerpeutic GOLD 500 XLS Foldable Upright Bike
customer_reviews.text: Exerpeutic GOLD 500 XLS Foldable Upright Bike (MONITOR) for time, heart rate ..only LASTED for 4 months. Change the batteries and it still did NOT work . I guess I received a bad one. I contacted the company for a replacement and they said that it was out of WARRANTY. Good Luck with the piece of junk when it breaks down.
customer_reviews.author: DFL

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Noise To Keep
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike a few weeks ago when COVID-19 closed the gyms & I really like the height, the color, and the seat's width. It is also very sturdy for me (260lbs), but I do have it sitting on an area rug. However, this noise coming from I suppose the wheel area is driving me nuts. I normally went to the gym at 5am while my husband slept, unfortunately I cannot ride this bike because it wakes him up. Therefore, I have to return the bike because I'm not able to ride it when I need too.
customer_reviews.author: Frenchi

customer_reviews.title: Works well for short females 5"0-5"1
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the Exerpeutic gold Heavy duty foldable bike (smaller model/bike for those under 350lbs) I absolutely love love love this bike! I am a female between 5 foot 0 and 5 foot 1 inch and it fits me really well! I can even stand up on it for brief stints in the 2nd and 3rd position. It doesn't rock and the tension levels are effective! The display doesn't do much but they are never really helpful so I downloaded a stopwatch app on my phone for time and such. Its quiet and a great find, I saw it was sold out shortly after I bought it but this was a great find!
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Great for tall people
customer_reviews.text: I went with this new model because it says it fits people up to 6'5". I am 6'4" and I don't have this set up anywhere near the highest seat setting. I can easily imagine this fitting someone well up to 6'8", if not taller. It is extremely easy to assemble, quiet, comfortable and all features perform great.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Plummer

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little exercise bike.
customer_reviews.text: I have no space in my house for exercise equipment...the fact that this could be folded up was the main reason I purchased it. It's light enough that I'm able to move it for use then tuck it back away in the corner for storage. I put it together in about 2 hours by myself and I'm a 60 year old out-of-shape woman. I like that the tension is easy to adjust, the seat is wide, and it is so quiet. I purchased the mat, too, thinking it might tend to slide on hardwood floors but that hasn't been a problem. All-in-all, I'm very pleased with this purchase: price was right, size is right, ease of use is right.
customer_reviews.author: SundaySchoolTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Compact, stable, and super quiet. I live in an upstairs apartment and have no worries about the bike disturbing my neighbors.The large seat is about as comfortable as any bike seat is going to be on my old-lady rear. Also, I'm barely 5' 2", with short legs, and it fits well. The large pedals are comfortable, but I prefer to wear my walking shoes when pedaling and the shoes even allow me to raise the seat above the lowest setting. Assembled it by myself in about 20 minutes; just read the instructions and follow step-by-step.
customer_reviews.author: WalksWithCats

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: First it wasn't that easy to put together especially the tension part. Then the hook on the right pedal broke off when I went to remove the strap realizing I put it on backwards. It just snap right off so easily I couldn't believe it! So I have a bike with no strap. Hopefully they could send me a right pedal. Again poorly made. But I guess you pay for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: debskiluv

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with purchase so far. I was able to assemble it myself following the step by step directions. (4 basic steps, tools included with purchase) I was concerned that the bike may not be able to accommodate my height. (usually get a 33 inch when ordering pants) I am 5 foot 8 inches and have long legs. It works and there is even room to move the seat up a couple more notches. The bike is very quiet. The seat is padded and ok (what bike seat doesn't hurt when you start riding?) Looking forward to getting in shape and enjoying my new bike.
customer_reviews.author: KellyGirl68

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality but they have to cut corners somewhere...
customer_reviews.text: Overall very happy with the bike. Assembly took around 45 minutes. Pieces are fairly heavy but manageable. The only issue I came across was the pedal straps are very cheap soft plastic which broke when I went to attach them to the pedals. Not a huge deal, bike works as advertised. Nice solid flywheel with good tension which is adjustable with the knob on the control panel. Instructions were pretty clear for the most part. I'm sure most people can figure them out without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: GREATEST PRODUCT EVER PURCHASED
customer_reviews.text: We cannot believe the quality and price of this product. My wife and I sat down and assembled this is minutes. Afterwards we both tried it out and could not believe the comfort and smoothness of this cycle. I for one am Greatful for the capacity of the bike. Trying to find something to guarantee weight capacity was difficult and then not only did we find it the price was unbelievable. It was to good to be true however, I needed something to help us along and was willing to take the chance. It is well worth every penny and the wife loves it just as much. Thank you for such a great product it has changed our lives.
customer_reviews.author: jcv: a great product especially the display

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy from this company again. Hand pulse ...
customer_reviews.text: Will never buy from this company again. Hand pulse stop working only after 10 days well within warranty period. I informed company but refuse to stand by warranty. On day 31 the exerpeutic started to make loud noise. It the bearings. BUYER BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: First one we ordered didn’t even work, made lots of noises and could hardly peddle on it. Also the tension didn’t work at all. Got a replacement and it worked 2 days and then started breaking down, making weird loud ticking noises cycling at faster speeds and not working well. Also even if you’re in the “recommended” height, if your legs are shorter than your torso it may not work for you. Even at the smallest setting I barely reach the peddles and I’m 5’2” and my husband is 6’2” and still has the seat shorter than normal and has a hard time reaching the peddles.
customer_reviews.author: Aranel

customer_reviews.title: Well built and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a upright simple bike to help lower my blood sugar, and easy on knees. The reason I am writing a review is why I buy the items I do on amazon. The reviews have given great advice on which products to purchase. My blood sugar was 98 this morning, best it's been in months. This excise bike is easy to move around, and so far no problems with the knees.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick ONeil

customer_reviews.title: NEVER AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: There's no point in buying an exercise bike with 8 levels of resistance if the tension cable that's supposed to provide the resistance provides NONE. The tension cable requires the customer to connect the tension cable pieces, one from the cycle base and one from the handlebars, during assembly. Since the printed directions weren't helpful, I contacted Paradigm support, and after two emails was directed to a video showing how to connect the two pieces of cable. I followed those directions, but the cable still provided no resistance. I replied back to the company, waited 3 days, got no response, and gave up on this item ever working for me.
customer_reviews.author: David S

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm a runner and bought this for warming up before outdoor winter runs. It is a sturdy quality product for the price. I used it for a few main work outs on days when it was too icy and I didn't want to break my neck outside. It did the job and I was happy to watch tv while exercising. It's quiet too. I put a desk fan on myself for cooling while using it and that was noisier. The only bad thing is it's so boring. I prefer to be moving through time and space while I exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppah617

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, but it only lasts a few months.
customer_reviews.text: I use the bike 4-6 times per week for 40 minute rides at 6 an/or 7 tension level. My speed is usually between 9 and 10 mph. I am 5’0” and I weigh 195 pounds. I loved this bike for the first few months of use. I started using it in February and by August the threads on the pedal bolts began to shred, leaving metal shards on the floor below. It is now October, and the pedals are close to falling off completely as half of each pedal bolt has been destroyed. I guess this is still cheaper than a gym membership, but I hate to be wasteful. If
customer_reviews.author: Jen Budmen

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise bike, but avoid the bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: This bike has worked out great for the whole family, ranging in height from 5' 3" to 5'10". I especially like how quiet it is. We keep it in our eat-in kitchen and you can ride the bike while others are watching TV or reading nearby without disturbing them. I could never have done this with past bikes i've owned. The seat is reasonably comfortable for a brief workout. I haven't gone over 20 minutes yet. The bluetooth myCloudFitness feature is a disappointment. About 20% of the time it won't connect with my phone for some unknown reason. I took advantage of an offer to have someone come out and assemble it, and he did a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Don Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Basic but perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I only got this one because I am immensely fat and I did not want to buy something that would collapse underneath me. It is very basic and you definitely need TV or something to entertain you while you ride, but it is perfect for me. Much to my surprise I have been using it consistently and it is helping. Easy to assemble, easy to collapse, easy to roll from place to place. It exceeds my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen marie merewether

customer_reviews.title: Ajust tension by pulling cable up
customer_reviews.text: No good instructions on tightening tension cable. Before sending back, make sure you use a good pair of locking vise grip type pliers and pull cable up as far as you can before hooking it. Remove part 15. Little piece of plastic. Tape it in space inside bike for future use. It is a lock which interferes with tension. That is the reason people send bike back. If you have knowledge about tension cables such as tighening brakes and strong hands you can handle this bike. Company should have a video on instructions to adjust tension if they want successful business. Well built for long lasting use.
customer_reviews.author: Manteck

customer_reviews.title: Exerpeutic is running a scam
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing this bike, it quickly broke (likely a failed bearing in the wheel system), becoming extremely noisy. After a long runaround with the support at Paradigm Health & Wellness (the company making Exerpeutic), they appear to be attempting to swindle me. Promising a refund (without taking into account the tax I have had to pay) and never sending that refund after the paperwork for it was completed. In general, the support was incredibly unresponsive & continuously uncooperative.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last
customer_reviews.text: As others pointed out, this piece of equipment does not last. Gears started slipping in my case about 12 months after purchase, and the bike became unusable about 18 months after purchase. I will spend more $$ on a durable piece of equipment next time around.
customer_reviews.author: Kathrin M. Bernt

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT RECOMMEND! BELT BREAKS QUICKLY
customer_reviews.text: This is a frustrating product because it simply breaks so easily. Two months into using it moderately and the belt slips hard after 4 revolutions, essentially making it impossible to use comfortably. It would be a good product if it didn’t just break.
customer_reviews.author: DTowns

customer_reviews.title: 80 miles so far and loving it!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a simple but reliable and durable stationary bike for some light cardio. My main focus was to keep a damaged knee moving. I love this bike so far. It's very durable and fairly easy to assemble. Take your time, and in under 60 minutes you'll have it ready to go. So far, it's very smooth and quiet. The handlebars seem pretty far forward, but that's fine since I prefer to just sit upright and bike without holding the bars. If you're over 6'4, this bike is not for you. I'm just under 6'4 and on the highest seat setting.
customer_reviews.author: Wo kommst du

customer_reviews.title: Love the seat
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy. I weighed 377 when I started. I locked the seat in place by screwing the knob in all the way when I found the perfect height. Easy to unscrew when others want to use it. I just like the extra security. The seat is massive. I will throw a pillow under my butt from time to time for longer workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve K. Kay

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and study 2-years in!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike in 2018 and it’s still going strong 2 years later. Very sturdy. Easy to move and I’ve gotten decent workouts on it (I’m down 35 lbs). I’ve been using this bike nearly daily since the pandemic started. Such a great bike at a very reasonable price point! My only issue with the bike is that you cannot effectively workout out of the seat because of how far out the pedals are spaced from the body. This design was likely why it has such a high weight capacity, but it limits the max intensity you can get from a workout. For those who care, I’m 5’-8” and 246 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: RRW81

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise bike
customer_reviews.text: This exercise bike was a great buy for what I paid. It's quite and easy to fold up and move around. I'm 5' 2" and had to buy the Little Giant Ladder to get up on the seat but I can reach the petals just fine but any shorter and I think there would be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: CAROL

customer_reviews.title: Indoor exercise bike
customer_reviews.text: Was exactly as I through. Works great and is quiet. Very easy to assemble. Seat is hard and had to put cushion on seat. Good instrumentation. Easy to move around. FYI, I am 71 and 250 pounds. When I was 18, I ran the 440 in 51 seconds, 1/2 mile in 2 minutes and weighed about145. This is exactly what I need.
customer_reviews.author: B Kamin

customer_reviews.title: Best exercise equipment investment yet!
customer_reviews.text: I love my exercise bike! I read all the reviews before I purchased to confirm my decision. I have a compression fracture, arthritis, spinal stenosis and scoliosis in my spine and a bad knee. I almost gave up all hope on an exercise routine that would help me. I love my bike, I set it up by the TV and jump on it during the day. It it sturdy, comfortable and I can adjust the tension to meet my needs. I average 4-10 miles every day. I've gained back muscle strength in my knees, hips and back. Wish I'd bought it sooner!!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Started Makin LOUD Noise in 5 Months
customer_reviews.text: First got the bike for my wife who was recovering from a broken hip. It worked great for her to get hip and legs in shape. The bike was quiet, easy to move and does not take a lot of space. Even though she weighs a little over a hundred pounds I bought her the Heavy Duty. Five months later a loud noise developed. I checked the pedals and pedal arms for tightness without any luck. According to the Amazon Website it is supposed to have a one year warranty though when looking, the companies website has no contact information. Very Disappointing!!
customer_reviews.author: art wiltz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Two weeks after purchase the internal bearing started to make a loud noise. Called support and they need to replace it. My two cent, the product looks sturdy but it’s obviously not nicely build if a bearing breaks only after two week of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My older version still runs fine
customer_reviews.text: I bought an older version of this bike in 2015. It still runs fine. My family gets tired of it and no longer uses it as often as before, they got newer toy now. But I tried it last week and that bike still keeps on ticking. However I have to say that we don't run it on higher resistance so maybe that is the reason this machine still works fine. It is well worth the money already and I have no complaint.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike I weigh over 500lbs and this bike is very sturdy and easy to assemble I was a little nervous that it wouldn’t be and it super quiet best investment I made this year
customer_reviews.author: sherman farley

customer_reviews.title: Starting to make noise
customer_reviews.text: I have about 1400 miles on mine & it has started to make a clunking noise around 1200 miles. The noise is coming from the front internal magnetic resistance area so disassembly isn’t an option. I will say that other than this, I like this “bike”. If you’re a casual user, this should be a great option. If you’re more serious & plan to put some serious miles on it, maybe not (unless you are more mechanically inclined than me & can perform maintenance on the internal working parts). For the price I don’t think it’s worth having it serviced & I will probably just keep using it until it falls apart. Decent product for the price
customer_reviews.author: Town Noob

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for a big person!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Bike. I was worried my super sized belly would stick out too much, but there was absolutely no issue. Its very quiet, the pedals go around very smoothly, and the seat is the largest I have ever had. And believe me my enormous derriere is grateful. Other seats you can tell are made for very thin people, when I would sit on them I'd feel violated. Ugh. This one, on the other hand, is perfect. Its at least twice the size of a traditional seat, maybe even three. As a much larger then average person, I highly recommend this to anyone especially other bbw, ssbbws and bhm.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Must adjust sit so no pelvic or back pain. Learned the hard way. Besides that perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.AAP

customer_reviews.title: in fact better than some bikes we saw in Sears for much ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my husband who was getting restless from being housebound due to the rain this year. The bike came as promised, and he had it assembled in very little time. The bike is very high quality, in fact better than some bikes we saw in Sears for much more money. The hubby has been using it everyday, and loves it. It did develop a little squeak, but re-tightening the fittings around the pedals takes care of it. Overall a very sound investment.
customer_reviews.author: Nursey40

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for beginner level
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little bike to get a bit of cardio fitness in, or a warm up before some more intense training. Great for a beginner like myself, wouldn't recommend for an avid cyclist as it has pretty limited features. Easy to set up, use, and move.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: This is exercise bike is AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife used this exact model in a hospital she was in for a couple of weeks, which greatly improved her condition! On returning home we checked to see if we could find the same exact one on Amazon (which we did). It arrived quickly, but the most IMPRESSIVE thing was there was no scratches, dents, mark, etc. on any part whatsoever!!! This thing is VERY NICE and VERY GOOD QUALITY!!! Very easy assembly (if you follow the instructions). Have used it now at several times for several days and works WONDERFULLY!!! I would recommend this product for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Idk how long it was k. Warehouse...?
customer_reviews.text: Well. Just got it today. Assembly: super easy. Functionality: I'm 5'0 and using it fairly okay lol. But oh god, find THIS under one of the petals. Spiders?!? 😭😭😭 I'm still grossed out with this surprise when I grabbed it. Very agoraphobic so it was a bit traumatic for me. Double check yours when taking it out.
customer_reviews.author: Megzilla

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner's compact exercise bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a good beginner's exercise bike and I'm enjoying using it. It shipped quickly and was very simple to put together by myself. The larger bike seat accommodates my larger seat just fine. It doesn't take up too much space when in use, and it folds up and rolls away easily. There are sensors on the handles and some basic program modes to monitor your progress. I say this is a good beginner's bike because the tension knob has levels 1-8, but the overall tension just doesn't go as high as I'd hoped it would. I still feel this was a good value for my money and I would recommend it to someone who is starting out.
customer_reviews.author: CSW

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. Waited three months for my husband to put it together for me and finally decided to try myself. Had it assembled in about 45 minutes. Easy to use. I am 5’4 and have to have it on the lowest setting to use. Not designed for very short people. Everyone in family enjoys using it. Very quiet...I use it while watching television often. Would recommend the protective pad for the floors just so it doesn’t move around on wooden floors.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 6 months no reply from support.
customer_reviews.text: I sent a message to the company in December, and I understand the holidays happened, but I am now 20 days into January and they still have not responded. I have had the bike for about 6 months with little to moderate use. The cable inside is broken and throws the tension off. I did like the bike while it worked, but breaking down so quickly and the terrible support is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck .
customer_reviews.text: Bike is very sturdy and easy to put together the only down side as someone else tried to explain is that the tension of the bike may need to be adjusted depending on your preference (my daughter and I are using it for weight loss so resistance is important) , but thanks goodness my son In law works on bikes other wise I wouldn't have felt much difference is the risitance ! But all around this is a fabulous , no noise and is perfect for taller individuals.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Scriver

customer_reviews.title: Broken in four days
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I saw good reviews. We received the bike 4 days ago and we assembled it. My wife and I started using it for about 45 minutes each everyday. Today we found out that it is making a annoying noise while we were working out . It's been only four days!!
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Connector plug in is bad
customer_reviews.text: Received it quickly. Easily assembled in about 45 minutes (taking my time). Something is wrong with the connection plug in. None of the tracking stuff works consistently, in goes in and out and only tracks my stats when the wires are jiggled.😬 Sucks because if I wanted to send it back I'd have to disassemble and repack every piece and that's just ridiculous. The bike still gives me a work out, I'm just in the dark about my stats while riding. If it wasn't for that this bike is actually nice and light. Folds up easily and has been a good addition to my daily routine.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Delane

customer_reviews.title: ... ALMOST 8 MONTHS I BELIEVE IT TO BE AN EXCELLENT PIECE OF EXERCISE EQUIPMENT
customer_reviews.text: HAVING OWNED THIS BIKE FOR ALMOST 8 MONTHS I BELIEVE IT TO BE AN EXCELLENT PIECE OF EXERCISE EQUIPMENT. I DO HAVE SEVERAL MINOR CRITICISMS. THE PANEL WHICH INDICATES LEVELS OF RESISTANCE IS ALMOST IMPOSSIBLE TO READ. IT SHOULD HAVE A BACK LIGHT OF SOME SORT.ALSO, THE INSTRUCTION BOOKLET DOES A GOOD JOB OF SHOWING HOW TO ASSEMBLE THE BIKE , BUT DOES LITTLE TO EXPLAIN WHAT THE LEVELS OF RESISTANCE REPRESENT (E.G.,HILL GRADIENT,PEDDLING IN MUD). I ALSO FOUND CALORIES BURNED SEEMED THE SAME NO MATTER WHAT THE LEVEL OF RESISTANCE OR THE SPEED.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. McCauley

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sturdy exercise bike! It took me 1.5 hours to assemble by myself, but it was easy. They provided all the parts and tools to complete the assembly. The seat is comfortable and the sound is quiet during pedaling. Only downside, given I'm only 5'3", I can raise the seat past 1 notch otherwise I can't reach the pedals. This is due to the seat bar being tilted in a wide V position. Otherwise, I love the tension settings and the led panel for viewing multi-settings for heart rate, minutes, RPM, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mz Lady

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great exercise bike! Delivered 3 days before expected. Very quiet and smooth pedal. All electronic parts work great. Downloaded MyCloud Fitness app on IPhone XR and have had no problems. App seems to accurately reflect progress and workout. Connects via Bluetooth. Had no issues with connectivity. Manual Magnetic tension makes for a light or strenuous cardio exercise. Overall a great purchase for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: bakergirl28

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, great price
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely pleased with this stationary bike. I did not want a heavy, pricy bike, just one I can work out on daily. It is solid and has more than adequate intensity levels. I've told friends about this bike, but unfortunately availability has been scarce. Guess I ordered at just the right time.
customer_reviews.author: K. Voss

customer_reviews.title: Not for Short People
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this bike and its sub standard. First its not smooth to peddle. Second, I'm 5'1 and I assembled it per the directions using the holes towards the front and I still have to lean quite a bit forward to peddle. Lastly, I had issues with the display lighting up but not tracking. I sent a note to customer service which took awhile to get a response. They sent me a video which had nothing to do with my issue. I sent them another response and as of this review I still have not heard back; however, I was able to fix the issue with the wires.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Clicking Sound when Pedaling
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I like the exercise bide BUT the constant clicking when I pedal ruins the entire workout experience for me. I have tried to contact the vendor many times in various ways but can't get help from anyone -nobody seems to be available. I am also unable to contact Amazon customer service for guidance but have been unable to communicate with them either.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Bike arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: The left petal was stripped. Bike cannot be assembled. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: seth brodacz

customer_reviews.title: Customer service lacking
customer_reviews.text: Customer service will not respond to request for assistance or replacement due to constant clunking noise with every pedal rotation. This started happening with less than 50 miles on the bike. Avoid this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!  Rugged and simple to use. FIVE STARS!
customer_reviews.text: This a great buy. We are impressed with it's rugged, but simple frame, it's quietness, it's vomfortable seat and it's easy graphics. It doesn't have a lot a bells and whistles- just enough to easily select tension and to be informed of distance, speed and heartbeat. It folds up well for it's sturdiness and gets out of the way even in our small trailer. The only small criticism we have is that the rollers are very small and only work easily on bare floors. But this is a great buy and has destroyed any excuses about having to walk in the rain. We have told many friends about it's usefulness and ruggedness.
customer_reviews.author: Pescher

customer_reviews.title: Solid, great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Solid bike, good for doing regular cardio. Extremely quiet and feels solid. I have been using it five to six days a week since I got it. I use it for both steady state and HIIT and it gets the job done. Really no complaints for the price. More levels of resistance would be nice. Not much difference in the resistance from one to five. Six and seven are noticeably more intense, but eight is full on. Having even a few more levels in between 7 and 8 would really extend the usefulness. But good bike, sturdy, great weight capacity and very quiet. Especially if you are just starting out, you will get a lot of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: D. C. Woomer

customer_reviews.title: Use WD40 to install the pedals
customer_reviews.text: Installing the pedals was the only difficult part of the assembly. Idk why the threading was so messed up, but the pedals haven’t fallen off yet., so I guess it’s fine. The bike is very comfortable, and very easy to use. I’m a really large person. I weighed over 350. The seat is comfortable. Love this bike!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Boykin

customer_reviews.title: Broken part not once but twice
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this bike. The reviews are great, and it looks like a solid make. I was never able to enjoy it, however, because not once but TWICE the bike got to us with a damaged part. And it was not even a situation where we could have ordered a replacement piece as the damaged part (motor cover) would require us to dismantle the bike. How hard is it to pack your product so that it arrives undamaged? Well, apparently really hard. I am really upset. The bike looks well built, and I was really looking forward to using it.
customer_reviews.author: Paula S. Fonseca-Bai

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken
customer_reviews.text: I am so sad as I was really looking forward to this bike. Sadly, mine came broken. The plastic top that goes on the wheel thing was broken. Some of the plastic was in the wheel opening and I could not get it out. The bad part was I had already starting putting this together before I noticed this. I had to take parts of it back apart to send it back. I wish it would have worked out, but I am scared to try to buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly C.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive build quality and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: Just got this so I'm not sure about it's durability but it is a very solid bike. Very simple to assemble and doesn't wobble at all. The handlebars, the seat and base doesn't move one bit. Super smooth and quiet. The riding position is a little weird as the pedals are in front of you rather than underneath you. Not like a recumbent bike but like that a little. It folds up enough to stick in a corner and would be out of the way. I can't wait to see how this holds up.
customer_reviews.author: EagleOne

customer_reviews.title: So far worth every dollar!
customer_reviews.text: Bike totally worth it for the price! Easy assembly, plus resistance can be modified to make it difficult
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews, I decided to purchase this stationery bike. It took 30 minutes to assemble out of the box. It is everything I've read. It doesn't take a lot of room, it's solid, quiet (no one in the house knows I'm riding when they are sleeping), and attractive to look at. In fact, it's a great quality purchase for the price. I'm not an avid bike rider, but this keeps me moving at home, even when catching up on my television shows or listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: P. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great price and very good for bigger people
customer_reviews.text: This bike went together fast, even with my 5yo helping me. I'm a plus plus girl and this easily hold me. As comfortable as a bike can be after not being on one for 20 years! Like that it's adjustable in height, would like it better to be an handle bars but that's a preference. Folds up small and pretty easily. Takes a few days for that to be smoother but after 1-2 weeks, even my kid can do it. Worth the money and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Aymber

customer_reviews.title: strong, smooth and quiet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Really solidly built. Simple display and controls. I'm heavy and this machine really take my weight fine. The seat is very large and doesn't hurt on long rides. I like that folds and you can just roll it out of the way when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Osborn

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to put together it is quiet. Very portable, I keep it in my room open up in the am for some cardio while I watch a movie or Youtube, makes the cardio go faster, lol. Great product so far so good. I am 5"6 I have it on the lowest seat setting but I wanted this model because it is sturdier and also if my 6'2" son wants to use it he can. I primarily got this for post-hip surgery, since I would not be able to get out of the house much. Has been perfect for getting leg and muscles stronger.
customer_reviews.author: sprtsgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: There aren't that many exercise bikes out there designed for very heavy people. Most bikes aren't rated for more than 300 pounds. You can probably put more weight on one of those than they are rated for. But, why take the chance on a potential failure and serious injury when you can buy this bike at a much lower price than most heavy duty bikes and its even portable and easy to store as well.
customer_reviews.author: Two Zero

customer_reviews.title: Digital display does not work/ Sturdy and does fold up well
customer_reviews.text: I waited for this bike to get back in stock. I was so excited to put it together and try it out. The bike is compact and can fit in my coat closet. It is sturdy. The bike seat is comfortable. I am 5 ft 10 in tall and can ride very comfortably. The display lights up but only displays zeros. Which is not very motivating. I rode the bike for 30 minutes and nothing displayed except for pulse. In general, I am disappointed after waiting so long not to be able to see my distance, time, etc. I was offered a discount to resolve the issue and will just use my phone to keep time.
customer_reviews.author: Tarah

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bike,  feels high end
customer_reviews.text: It is big and it is heavy. However it is also excellent for smooth, quiet and stable biking. We own two bikes, the other is WIRK bike with a desk on it. I love the desk and think that it is as good a low end bike as the two SUNNY brand bikes we rode into the ground. There were 6 girls riding it back then. We bought this bike for my 6ft 185lb husband to use as a rehab bike, but it has become the favorite one for my teenage daughters too. I ride the WIRK one more often but IMO this is definitely the better of the two for a smooth comfortable ride.
customer_reviews.author: Yarnfinder

customer_reviews.title: Solid!!! Stable!!! Affordable!!
customer_reviews.text: Only used 1 week. Have to say this thing is solid! Not some super expensive high tech piece of equipment but solid! I weigh 355lbs and I'm 6"2. The label on the leg of the bike I received says 400lbs capacity. This thing is stable. I wouldn't try to over do it by riding it standing up or like I'm trying to fly. This is a good way to break up other options. I ride mornings while watching videos, sports, news or movies right in front of my big screen TV. Affordable! Will update in a few months. Might use washers to space the pedals a bit until I lose weight.
customer_reviews.author: Essence

customer_reviews.title: Exercise bike broke after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Exerpeutic Gold Heavy Duty Foldable Exercise Bike w/400 lbs wt. capacity on a Wed and it was delivered the next Thurs. (8 days). It was reasonably simple to assemble. It weighs about 55-60 lbs, and I can lift that without too much trouble. I rode it about 10 miles per day until the 6th day when it started making a loud clicking/grinding noise coming from the wheel assembly. It was fairly comfortable and stable and I enjoyed using it until the noise started. I am following up with Amazon and Exerpeutic to resolve the situation. I hate that it has a major problem within just one week!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Rollins

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was definitely not expecting such a sturdy, nice quality bike for this price. The kit was just missing one flat washer, so I’ll have to find one from a hardware store, but I like this bike so much that I don’t mind. The seat is very comfortable, by the way! I love the simplicity; there’s no unnecessary feature. I’m fascinated about how quiet it is! **Here’s hoping it lasts:) I’m writing this review after 2 days of using it.
customer_reviews.author: D D

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy enough for 300+ pound people. Seat can be uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: This is a great sturdy bike! I’m 300 pounds so when looking for a bike having a larger weight capacity was super important. This bike doesn’t feel cheap when I’m riding it and it doesn’t wiggle like some other equipment I’ve used. CONS: I would give this a 4.5 stars if I could because the heart rate monitor doesn’t work which is okay because I have a fitbit but after the first day it never worked again. The seat is a little uncomfortable so it you plan on riding longer than 20 minutes I recommend a padded seat cover.
customer_reviews.author: Betts

customer_reviews.title: Good bike, but only if you're taller and don't require higher resistance settings
customer_reviews.text: Pretty well built overall, Easy to assemble and looks good. Since it has a magnetic strip, it's quiet too. However, two main issues for me: 1) I'm 5'2", but my legs are too short to reach the pedals comfortably. 2) Resistance settings don't go as high as I'd hoped. Not important for longer workouts, but doesn't even come close to the intensity of going uphill. Also, at the highest resistance, it doesn't feel smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: $200 down the drain
customer_reviews.text: 15 minutes into the build and all downhill. Left nylon nut is basically welded to the left pedal. Unable to finish build. Junk
customer_reviews.author: Chris Yang

customer_reviews.title: Ride while watching TV
customer_reviews.text: My gym closed down during the pandemic so this bike has helped a lot. I weigh 280 pounds so most bikes won’t hold me.
customer_reviews.author: R. Harford

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy seat and quiet!
customer_reviews.text: This Experpeutic bike, which supports 400lbs is amazingly sturdy without being over bulky, heavy or difficult to maneuver... Very easy to assemble as comes partially assembled! A surprisingly wide and thick seat is very comfortable . The bike is very quiet and the tension knob is easy to adjust. Battery operated means not tethered to a cord/outlet. This bike can be placed anywhere!. The digital read out gives me the information I really need, ,calories burned, distance, biked, time, heart rate etc. This is the bike us big guys needs! Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low quality crap
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to assemble... I’ll give them that. But don’t bother purchasing this garbage unless you inexplicably have your heart set. Pedaling belt got ripped within two months of the purchase time and after contacting the customer support at Exerpeutic , filling out the parts order form as directed, I received a text message from the company asking me to resubmit the request; a typical time-wasting tactic.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and stable
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bike every other day for 2 weeks and it has met my needs for a smooth, quiet ride with adequate feedback via the screens. The seat is massive but I sit on the front edge only and find it works fine for me even though I am slim and tall. The peddles have good straps. There are only 8 resistance options. but they are ok. The bike ride is very smooth and nearly soundless.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I really love this bike. I’m a seasoned cyclist, I’ve been cycling as my primary form of exercise for 10 years and naturally I’ve gone through quite a few stationary bikes, and this one initially impressed me quite a bit. Easy to assemble (took me about half an hour, probably less) and it’s very small and very quiet. Resistance feels good, I’ve had bikes with more and bikes with less, the max setting feels just about right for me. All in all I’m really happy with this bike. The true test will be how long it lasts, if it dies on me after a short period of time I’ll update my review, but for now I really love it!
customer_reviews.author: irmcgraw11

customer_reviews.title: Poor choice- assembly problems, flywheel is light- no support
customer_reviews.text: Wow, so many problems. Assembly directions missing some detail, no help from customer support, flywheel too light, questions on quality. Can't adjust resistance properly. I do not recommend this bike.
customer_reviews.author: jim4fun

customer_reviews.title: This is a quality stationary exercise bike
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed, easily assembled and all the bolts, screws and pins fit exactly together with the frame. The seat assembly includes height and forward adjustment options. Very sturdy and stable. The resistance adjustment is well placed and offers a good range of required pedal power. 4 stars instead of 5 due to where it was manufactured. Still, very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Recently had a baby and so I was looking for something foldable, cheap and would help me get my cardio in while baby is napping. If you are in my shoes this is a great bike for you. Really good exercise bike for the price! Takes about 15 minutes to set up. Folds away pretty small and the wheels on it help move from room to room very sturdy. I'd recommend if you're a beginner at it like me. Only thing I wish was different was that the time you bike for restarted every time you exercised. And I don't really notice a drastic change from tension 1 to tension 8..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This bike is just as described. My only complaints would be that the pedals are a little in front of you - not under you like a real bike, and the tentions adjustments are small increments between 1 - 7 but seems like a big jump from 7-8. Sems like thay could have added a couple of increments there. Other than that it is very smooth, sturdy, and quiet. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: I like it but...
customer_reviews.text: I like this bike. The problem is that it makes an internal knocking or tapping sound when I pedal. It has worked well so far but not sure how long it will last. The only challenging setting is number 8, the others are rather easy. I had no trouble with assembly. The seat is very comfortable and adjustable. I am 6’1” and it works well for me. I was not expecting a commercial exercise bike for $200. Again, my only issue is durability with the knocking sound.
customer_reviews.author: ejp-bjje

customer_reviews.title: For the tall people
customer_reviews.text: Good stationary bike for the large people. There is a lot right and a little that is wrong with this bike. The right - fits tall people and still works after a couple years of abuse. The wrong - very squeaky loud.
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy bike again.
customer_reviews.text: The bike is great for a month. After a month, there’s a knocking sound with each pedal. This is the 2nd bike we have received. First one had the same issue. We returned it with no problems with customer service. Now the 2nd bike is doing the same thing. Will be researching other stationary bikes. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality! Broke within three days.
customer_reviews.text: The noise level and setting are great BUT too bad the most important magnetic mechanism broke within three days. It is making loud clicking noise. It is coming from the piece that was preassembled so I did not have to do any assembly on it.
customer_reviews.author: D.A.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful bike for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I followed the reviews and got this bike! It is so quiet, folds up so easily, is easy to set up, and at such a great price! The only thing is that it is meant for taller people. I am 5’5 and have to use the lowest seat setting. I would not recommend it for anyone who is shorter than 5’5. My partner is 6’5 and he also loves this bike. Such a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Boan

customer_reviews.title: it was good until the gears started slipping
customer_reviews.text: The bike was great for a few months and then slowly the gears started slipping as you pedal. The gear belt needs to be replaced but finding and replacing the belt seem impossible. Now the bike is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: I love that this is a very quiet bike
customer_reviews.text: I first must say that I was shocked that I put it together by myself so quickly. I love that this is a very quiet bike. I can ride while I watch TV. It is sturdy, smooth and quiet bike that is gentle on my joints. I think it's great for people who want to restart exercising. For people who are already fit and in shape, you will find that there is not a drastic difference in the tension levels; 8 is the top tension but would probably feels more like a 3. However, this bike works for me and for the price I paid for it, I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: lawanda weatherspoon

customer_reviews.title: Working well now
customer_reviews.text: I’m writing a review with the hopes that I will get a response from the manufacturer. Got to step 4 of the instructions only to realize that the part is defective that the tension cord is supposed to attach to. The company is not taking phone calls right now... so I have sent an email and a part replacement request. I will do another update if this is ever fixed and resolved. Edited... Response was quick from the company and bike is up and running. The issue was resolved in less than 10 minutes once email with video was received. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Futura

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine for Tall People (6 ft. 3ish)
customer_reviews.text: I'm about 6 ft. 3 in., maybe a tad taller. I adjust to the second highest seat setting. I can see it working well for somebody 6 ft. 4 in, (maybe even 6 ft. 5 in.) Feels sturdy too. Seat is comfortable. Setup is relatively easy (about 15 minutes.) Only minor complaints: lots of little orange stickers to un-peel or scrape off.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Orlando

customer_reviews.title: If your plus size,  this is the bike for you!
customer_reviews.text: I am a plus size woman who has picked up more weight during this pandemic. I needed an exercise machine that was sturdy and comfortable. This is due to back issues that I have. This bike delivers! The seat is wide and comfortable. The pedals are wide and the actual bike is a quite ride. And for the price, this is a win, win! Oh and my son said the assembly instructions were easy to follow. Now I just pray I stay consistent with my workout regimen because the bike is the bomb.com! I'm so excited!!
customer_reviews.author: Sonya Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect basic stationary bike
customer_reviews.text: It's inexpensive, easy to assemble, easy to use, and easy to fold. Do be aware that it's rather heavy. A very basic stationary bike, so if that's what you're looking for this is what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Marian Waldman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use! Lots of information!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, adjust to height, seat is wide and comfortable , can select different tension for riding. Has wheels and will fold. I downloaded the app but had a hard time using it. If you hold on to both handles it will tell you speed, calories burned, heart rate, time and miles
customer_reviews.author: brookegreenlee

customer_reviews.title: Good bike for a guy that is partially paralyzed on the right side.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to help get more cardio in. I had brain surgery a few years ago and I am partially paralyzed on my right side. I still have balancing issues, however, this bike is stable and works well for me. It is easy to lock in my right foot. I can also track my time and miles. I like the tracker because it stops the time when I stop the bike to use the restroom, etc and the timer starts back up when I start using it again. I can also reset the tracker daily for time and distance while also keeping track of the overall distance usage
customer_reviews.author: Copper

product_meta.title: Exerpeutic Gold Heavy Duty Foldable Exercise Bike with 400 lbs Weight Capacity
feature_bullets: Heavy Duty and High Durability steel frame construction with up to 400 lbs weight capacity. 20% more steel than the Exerpeutic Folding Magnetic Upright Bike for more maximum performance.
An 8 level Magnetic Tension control system for an easier or more challenging workout.
Folds to 1/2 the size, so it is uniquely compact; Folded Dimensions: 26.4" L X 24.8" W X 57.5" H
Large comfortable seat cushion for people of any size, and easily adjustable to fit 5'1" to 6'5" user heights

An easy to read large computer LCD display that indicates calories burned, distance, time, speed, scan, pulse and odometer. Please refer user manual attached below for instructions and troubleshooting steps.
